name: openai-voices
title: OpenAI Voices
description: Text to speech powered by OpenAI
author: andypai

commands.name: read-selected-text
commands.title: Read Selected Text
commands.description: Immediately reads the selected text or clipboard content without confirmation.

commands.name: read-text-editor
commands.title: Read Text with Editor
commands.description: Opens an editor to review and modify text before reading aloud.

commands.name: onboarding
commands.title: Get Started
commands.description: Onboarding and configuration for OpenAI Voices.

preferences.name: model
preferences.title: Model
preferences.description: The TTS model to use. gpt-4o-mini-tts is the newest and most advanced.

preferences.name: voice
preferences.title: Voice
preferences.description: The voice to use for the text-to-speech.

preferences.name: instructions
preferences.title: Instructions
preferences.description: Optional instructions to guide the model's speech, affecting accent, tone, and emotion.

preferences.name: response_format
preferences.title: Response Format
preferences.description: The format for the audio output. WAV is recommended for low-latency streaming.

preferences.name: saveAudioFiles
preferences.title: Save Audio Files
preferences.description: Save generated audio files to ~/.cache/raycast-openai-voices/ for debugging and reuse.
preferences.label: Save Audio Files

scripts.prepublishOnly:
echo "

It seems like you are trying to publish the Raycast extension to npm.

If you did intend to publish it to npm, remove the \`prepublishOnly\` script and rerun \`npm publish\` again.
If you wanted to publish it to the Raycast Store instead, use \`npm run publish\` instead.

" && exit 1
